alert.note: Alert for Morris; Passaic (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 19 at 5:10PM EST until December 20 at 1:00PM EST by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in New Jersey... Pequannock River Below Macopin Dam affecting Morris and Passaic Counties. For the Pequannock River...including Macopin Dam...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Pequannock River below Macopin Dam. * WHEN...Until early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 5.5 feet, Road closures begin in both Butler and Bloomingdale due to flooding. At 6.5 feet, Both Main Streets in Butler and Bloomingdale flood. Several commercial properties are also flooded. The Hamburg Turnpike experiences significant flooding. Flooding expands to the east side of Bloomingdale. Sloan Park is flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:40 PM EST Tuesday the stage was 5.9 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 4:40 PM EST Tuesday was 6.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is cresting near 5.9 feet this evening. It will fall below flood stage tomorrow morning. - Flood stage is 5.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 5.9 feet on 03/07/2011. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Stream Fld Observed Fcsts (7 pm) Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Wed Thu Stg Time Date Pequannock River Macopin Dam 5.5 5.9 Tue 4 pm 4.9 4.6 5.9 7pm 12/19 &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/phi. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 515 AM EST.
